page.title: 08ROSEMARKET GIRL GUIDES
page.content: Guides began in Rosemarket in January 1961.There are now twelve guides and two guiders in charge of the company. The guide uniform is a blue blouse,a navy blue skirt,a navy blue hat,and a red_bordered,pale blue neckerchief. As well as from the village, Rosemarket guides come from Burton and Neyland.Guides pay 25p per week.You must be aged 10 or over to be a Guide. In 1985 the movement is celebrating its 75th Anniversary.As part of the celebrations some Rosemarket Guides took part in a special show at the Torch Theatre,Milford Haven.One patrol of the company won third prize in Wales for a play they wrote and acted about Anna and Zachariah Williams of Rosemarket.
